text: On credit sequence...
stretched out.  Long, alabaster white.  Beautiful.  A WAS CLOTH enters frame.  Starts washing the arm with long, te strokes.
thick and auburn.  Being gently washed.
being clipped with a shiny nail clipper.  Short.  Uniform Tidy.
brown with a touch of gold.  A BRUSH comes into view. Brushes against the eyebrow hair, then back again.  Again Then back again.
pulled gingerly off a long leg.  Folded neatly.  The wash cloth begins between the toes.  Warm, soapy water.

now dry.  The HAND appears with a comb.  Pulls down throu the thick tresses. It is only now that we see the hand is wearing a SURGICAL GLOVE. The gloved hand holds up the comb and pulls stray hairs f it.  Places them in a big, clear, plastic bag.  In the ba see the panty-hose, a folded flower dress, the nail clippings. Goes back to combing.  Comes across a knot and yanks the through.  The HEAD rolls over to us.  Her face is bruised her eyes blank.  She is lying on the floor. Dead. End of credit sequence.
The loud THRUM of a bush plane.  We CLOSE ON a small, clo window.  Through it we see an endless expanse of pine tre
Jesus.  Just look at all that.

PULL BACK to reveal HAP ECKHART and WILL DORMER sitting s by side.  Hap's at the window.  Greying moustache, a litt pudgy, wearing a brown suit.  Holding a folded over Seatt Times. HAP (cont'd) I thought we had a population problem. Everyone should just move up here. (taps window) Just look at it, Will.
Will's eyes remain on the file on his lap.
I don't need to look at it.
Will Dormer.  Tall, handsome, expensively tailored suit. Snakeskin cowboy boots.  There's both a magnetism and a distance to him.  An intense mixture.  Hap glances at him
Nothing wrong with smelling the roses.
Will looks up.  We see the trace of a thick, ropy SCAR by Adam's apple.  There's tension between him and Hap, just below the surface.  He taps the file.
Tell that to her, partner.
a stack of 8x10 PHOTOGRAPHS.  Of the dead girl.  Her eyes puffed up from bruises.  The whites bloody.  Contusions a her breasts and shoulders.
Detective?
The PILOT's looking back at Will.  Wearing a leather red baron hat. PILOT (cont'd) Better check your belts.  We'll be landing in about fifteen minutes.
Will nods.  The plane lurches.  The file falls to the flo and the photographs scatter.  The pilot catches a glimpse them.  Looks at Will.
The small yellow plane veers left.  Clears a mountain top gives view to the spectacular Alaskan coastline.  The gre of the Bering sea, the blanket of pine trees, the jagged of the beaches.  Enormous.

A SIGN swinging in the wind: Nightmute, Alaska.  Halibut Fishing Capital of the World! PULL BACK to reveal it hanging from the eave of a small, corrugated building.  The "airport."  Nothing else for mi around. A mud-splattered Jeep Cherokee pulls up next to it.  Brak SCREECHING.  A YOUNG WOMAN hops out.  About 23.  Petite w short, brown hair. Peers up at the sky.  Brightens at the sight of the BUSH PLANE coming in for landing.  Smooths down her down vest. Making sure the GOLD SHIELD on her belt's visible.  Nervo Excited.
Eleanor?
ELLIE BURR turns.  Shields her eyes from the sun.  An OLD hosing down the side of the building.
Hey, Mr. Angstrom!
What're you doing here?
Ellie puffs up.
Police business.
Police business?
The old man screws up his face, confused.   MR. ANGSTROM (cont'd) Didn't you used to baby-sit for us?
I don't babysit any more, Mr. Angstrom. Just made detective three weeks ago.
A CAT jumps down off the roof.  Angstrom sprays it.
Boy, Charlie must be short-handed down at the station.

Ellie, used to not being taken seriously.  Turns back to ROAR of the bush plane as it taxis down the strip.  Comin a stop.  She hurries over as the door swings open and... WILL DORMER steps down.  Slipping on his sunglasses. Scanning the nothingness around him.  Spots the swinging sign.
"Halibut fishing capital of the world."
Hap, right behind him.  Rubs his neck.
This ought to be interesting.
(over the engine) Detective Dormer!
They look down.  Ellie reaches up and takes Will's bag. his hand.  Shakes it vigorously. ELLIE (cont'd) It's a huge honor to meet you!  Ellie Burr.  I'm here to take you to the station!
Will motions to Hap.
My partner...
Detective Eckhart!  I know!  Welcome to Nightmute!
She leads them away from the plane.  Takes Will's briefca
I just want to say how incredible it is  to have you working with us, Detective Dormer.  I've followed all your cases. Theodore Dineli, Frank and Casey Prud'homme, the Port Angeles shootings...
Opens the back of the Jeep.  Puts the bags inside. ELLIE (cont'd) ...And especially the Leland Street Murders.  That was my case study at the Academy.
The Pilot walks by.  Taps her on the shoulder.
Tell your dad the game's gonna start late this week, Ellie.
Sure thing, Spence.

She looks back at Will.  Can't help but focus in on his s Touches her own smooth neck.  In awe. ELLIE (cont'd) That's where Ronald Langley cut you in the basement of his father's house on 325 Leland, isn't it?
Will smiles, taken aback by this girl's exuberance.
You did your homework, Officer.
Actually...
She throws a quick glance at Angstrom.  Out of ear-shot.
I just made detective three weeks ago.
The Cherokee parked next to a police car outside a plain, storey building.  The Nightmute Police Department.  A tot pole stands out front.
Will Dormer!
Nightmute Police Chief CHARLES NYBACK gets up from behind desk with a big smile.  Ruddy, red hair sprinkled with gr Nyback wears a faded army sweater over his uniform.
I'll be damned!
Limps from behind his desk and gives Will a shake and a s on the back.
(warmly) How you doing, Charlie?
Nyback shakes Hap's hand.  A reunion.
Hey, Charlie.
Christ.  I haven't seen you boys since...
Just after Leland Street.
What's that, then?
Eight years.
Seven years.
Seven years?  Where does it all go?  That was some amazing time, though, wasn't it?
Looks at Will.  Down at his boots. CHIEF NYBACK (cont'd) You haven't changed a bit, Will.
Will.  Looks at Nyback's gut.
You have, Chief.
They LAUGH.  Eyes twinkling.
I knew that was coming.  I deserve it.
He starts back over to his desk.  Notices Ellie still standing by the door.  Points to Will. CHIEF NYBACK (cont'd) Pay attention to this man, Ellie.  He'll teach you how to be a great cop.
Ellie straightens.  Smiles.  Looks over at Will.
Yes, sir.
That's all, for now.
Ellie, realises they want to be alone.
Oh.  Right.  Okay.
Backs out.  Quietly closing the door behind her.  Will unbuttons his jacket.  Takes a seat.
Nice kid.
(sits with a SIGH) Got a love affair with police work. Drives me crazy with it.
Will surveys the fishing poles leaning against the gun ra
Keeping you busy up here, Charlie?
Hap picks up a cheap trophy.  Reads the base.
"2nd prize Great Kodiak Salmon Catch."
I told you seven years ago this was a  stepping stone to retirement.

Nyback nods to Hap's Seattle Times.  The headline:  "Deep Investigation into Special Branch"... CHIEF NYBACK (cont'd) Looks like it's a good time for you to get up here, too.  With all the bad business going on down at Special Branch.
Will and Hap share a look.  No more joking.  Hap folds ov the paper. CHIEF NYBACK (cont'd) Just five bad apples so far?
So far.
What's the D.A. got them on?
Four unwarranted shootings, witness intimidation, and cocaine theft.
Nyback winces.
How about you?  How you faring?
They're all over us, Charlie.
They're all over everybody.

I.A.'s calling themselves the "Corruption Task Force."  Can you believe that? Trying to root out any mistakes or "oversights" any other Detectives may have made over the years.  They're turning it into a witch hunt.  Something on the news about it practically every night.
Nyback pulls a stack of messages from his desk.
Got a bunch of messages here from some guy named Warfield.
Hap tosses a glance over at Will.
That's I.A.'s pit bull.
Wants me to keep him posted on all your movements up here.

Nyback turns and ceremoniously drops the messages into th trash. CHIEF NYBACK (cont'd) I'm just glad Buck could spare you a couple of weeks.  Take you out of the frenzy.  I gotta tell you, though, I sure don't miss big city police work.  Not that I was ever a great detective.  But up here there's no Bureaucracy.  No Public Relations.  No blurred lines. Just good guys and bad guys.  Simple.
A cloud passes over his face. CHIEF NYBACK (cont'd) Except for this.
Holds up a file.  The name written on the lip:  KAY CONNE
Nyback leads Will and Hap down a hallway.  Crooked plaque and black-and-white pictures line the walls.
Couldn't get a thing from the body.  Not a trace.  Town's never dealt with anything like this before.
They turn a corner and stop at a door.  Will glances up: MOOSE ANTLERS hanging over it. CHIEF NYBACK (cont'd) I've briefed everybody about your coming. They know to follow your lead.
Nyback opens the door onto...

...the bullpen of Nightmute PD.  Wooden desks, a couple computers, a jumbled corkboard, an impressive gun cabinet RADIO's playing. Three MEN look over.  A young uniformed cop and two guys heavy facial hair, Timberland boots, and flannel shirts. of them's part Inuit.  Ellie sits in the back.  Reaches o to turn off the radio. Will and Hap stand in the doorway.  Sticking out like sor thumbs in their suits.  Nyback jerks his thumb towards th
This is Detective Dormer and his partner Detective Eckhart.  On loan from Buck Lundgard, Seattle Robbery and Homicide Special Branch.  They'll be helping with the Connell case.
The Inuit, FRED DUGGAR, snorts.  Takes his feet of the de
Helping?
(ignoring him) Anything they need to see, you show them; anywhere they want to go, you take them. (nods to Fred) This is Detective Fred Duggar.  He's been leading the investigation up to now.
Will puts out his hand.
Detective...
Fred tugs at his dark handlebar moustache.  Stands.
Suppose you want to see the body.
Fred steps out of the station, pulls on a baseball cap.
We can walk from here.
He heads off across the parking lot.  Will and Hap exchan glance.
Guess that's what they call Alaskan hospitality.
Don't worry about him...
They turn.  Ellie's come up behind them.  Looks over at t hunched figure to Fred. ELLIE (cont'd) He's just mad 'cause you're taking over.
Fred stops up ahead.  Sees her.  Annoyed.
Ellie!  Go type something!
CLOSE ON a faucet.  A bead of water, quivering at the mou Falls with a BLIP!
Did a fundascopic examination and found papilledema and petechiae of the retina.

PULL BACK to reveal Will, Hap, and the COUNTY CORONER standing by a stainless steel table.  The naked body of K CONNELL is laid out before them.  Fred hangs back. The coroner tugs at her surgical gloves.  She's in her la seventies. CORONER (cont'd) Clear cause of death was herniation of the brain stem due to intracerebral hemorrhage.
Beaten to death.
Beaten to death.
Will points to the bruises on the body's shoulders and breasts.
What about these contusions?
Superficial.
Any signs of rape?
None.
The coroner starts to cover the body with a sheet. CORONER (cont'd) She was a nice girl.  Played flute with my granddaughter.
Will stays her hand.
Wait.

He pulls the sheet back down.  Studying the body of Kay Connell.  Starts walking slowly around the table.  In his element.  The faucet drips.  Drips.  Drips. He bends down to smell her hair. WILL (cont'd) He washed her hair.
Takes a handful and lets it fall from his fingers. WILL (cont'd) Combed it.
Continues around the table.  Picks up one of her hands. Examines her fingers, her nails. WILL (cont'd) Cleaned under her fingernails.  Clipped them.
Continues down around her feet.  Checks between her first second toes. WILL (cont'd) Toes, too. (to Fred) You found nothing on the body?
No.
No fibers, skin flakes, hairs...
Like I said, no.  We know about those things up here.
Will stands there.  Looking down at the body.  Slim.  You Beautiful.  Skin like marble.
He knew exactly what we'd be looking for. Made sure to cover up all his tracks.
Even the best make mistakes.
Will looks up and locks eyes with his partner.
Will and Hap enter the lobby of the Pioneer Lodge.  Big s fireplace and heavy ceiling beams.  MOOSE ANTLERS mounted above reception.  They put their bags down by the desk. around.
Lower forty-eight.
They turn.  RACHEL CLEMENT stands in a doorway behind the desk.  Dunking a teabag into a mug.  Long dark hair and intelligent eyes.
Lower forty-eight?
You're not from here.  I can tell by your walk.
Oh?  And how's that?
Unsure.
Hap smiles at her.  Will checks his watch.
Detectives Will Dormer and Hap Eckhart. There should be a reservation for us.
Rachel looks at him.  Goes to a small file box on the des
(to Hap) Your friend's all business.
I'm always all business.
He glances out the window.  It's as bright as day. WILL (cont'd) Is it really 9:30?
(nods) Alaskan summers.  Hope you're an easy sleeper.  It'll be like this all night.
She hands them two cards. RACHEL (cont'd) Sign here.

Will's taken off his jacket and is unpacking.  The room i sparse and creaky.  Bed dips in the middle.  He hangs a jacket in the armoire then returns to his suitcase.  Pull out his SMITH AND WESSON 45. Lays it on the bedside table.  Takes out a shoulder holst A back holster.  A handful of shells.  Lays them on the  table.  Then a small SMITH AND WESSON 39/13 9MM.  Checks magazine. There's a KNOCK on the adjoining door.
Me.
Will SLAPS the magazine back.
Come on in.
Hap opens the door.  A glimpse into his room: family PICT on his bedside table - a WOMAN and three teenage GIRLS.
See you have the same decor as my room.

He walks over to the big window.  It overlooks the harbor Big, snow-capped mountains in the distance.  One lone TUG in the harbor towing a freighter. HAP (cont'd) Same view, too. (looks out) I've been watching that tugboat for the last half hour.  So small, pulling all that weight. (beat) We have to talk, Will.
Will reaches into his suitcase.  Pulls out a shirt.
What do you want to talk about?
You know what about.
Will throws him a look.
We'll talk when we get back to Seattle.
When's that, a week?  Two weeks?... (heads over to him) We have to figure out a plan of action now.
You know my plan of action.
To do nothing.
That's right.
Dammit, Will.  Warfield had me locked up in his office again for five hours yesterday.  Five hours.  Asking all kinds of questions...
He's asking everybody questions.
But he's zeroing in on me.  On us. Everyone's talking about it.
He's just rattling your cage.
Well, I gotta tell you.  With a wife, three kids, and a pension plan in the balance, it's rattling hard.
We say nothing.  It goes away.  Simple as that.
Will goes back to his suitcase.  Hap follows.  A thin fil sweat on his upper lip.
(lowers voice) Look.  We've tampered with evidence. We've pushed witnesses.  We've planted shit.  And they're sniffing around like dogs.  Especially on the Dobbs case...
Will flares up.  Struck a nerve.  Turns to his partner.
Weston Dobbs killed an eight year-old boy and left him hanging in the basement like a piece of meat.  You remember that?
You know I remember that.
One word to I.A. and he walks.
Maybe not.  We could talk to Buck...
No way.
Cut some kind of a deal.  I heard that's  what Flynn's doing...

Mike Flynn's a dirty cop, Hap!  We are nothing like Mike Flynn.  We did what we needed to do to make sure that son-of- bitch Dobbs paid for what he did.  And every bastard like him.  We say one word about it and every case we ever brought in is going to blow wide open and they'll all walk.  Every last one.  And I am not going to let that happen.  No deals.  No compromises.  No discussions.
He grabs a hanger.
Goddammit, Will.  You grab on to something and you don't let it go.
He takes out a handkerchief.  Wipes his brow.

I don't know if it's because you think it's the right thing to do or because your pride won't let you do anything else.  I can't tell any more. (steps back) But I can tell you one thing.  I'm getting too old for this cowboy cop stuff.  Breaking the rules.  Cleaning up messes.  We're a dying breed, Will. You're a dying breed.  I.A., the D.A., all those reporters - they don't care what you did at Leland Street seven years ago.  They don't care that you've made this your life.  They don't care about getting the bad guy...
Will turns on his partner, eyes burning.
I care.
The partners, lock eyes.  Years of working together.  A thousand things unsaid.  Hap reaches for the door. HAP (cont'd) They're watching us, Will.  Like it or not.  They're watching us.

Will's asleep.  Kay Connell's folder open on his chest. dark in his room, quiet.  Suddenly the shade on his windo quivers and SNAPS up, flooding the room with light. Will's eyes pop open.  He rolls over to look at the clock 3:15.  Squinting, he gets up and walks over to the window We can see the rest of his scar.  Runs down deep across h sternum. He yanks the shade back down.  It bucks, then settles. Satisfied, Will returns to bed.  Plumps the pillow, pulls blanket up around him.  Closes his eyes. The shade lurches halfway.  Then SNAPS back up.  Light po in.  Will's eyes open.
You got to be kidding me.

Will jogs along in a Sonics sweatshirt, a ring of sweat around his collar.  He looks out over the harbor.  Fishin boats coming in with their early morning haul.  More hali He checks his watch.  Slows to a walk.  Looks up and sees Ellie Burr standing on the front steps of the Pioneer Lod Smiles.  Holds up some car keys.
Fred wants us to meet him at the Connell's.
Ellie driving.  A hula-girl, swinging from the rear-view mirror.  Will in the passenger seat.  Wearing a crisp sui Ellie hands him a take-out bag.
Brought you a bear claw.  Just in case you were hungry.
Will takes the bag.  Looks inside.  Yikes. ELLIE (cont'd) Local delicacy.
Think I'll pass.

He puts the bag on the dash.  Looks out the window. Nightmute's main street.  A line of shops.  Undistinguish Town Hall.  Elementary school up on a hill.  Sign out fro Sign-ups for Midnight Little League! WILL (cont'd) What kind of calls you get around here?
Oh.  You know.  Small-time stuff. Nothing like what you must get.  Mostly drinking-related problems.  Domestic abuse.  Barroom fights.  Stuff like that.
She shifts down.  Takes a steep turn. ELLIE (cont'd) In the summer months it's pretty quiet. That's when there's work out on the boats.  The rest of the year, though...
They pass a MAN walking along the road.  Gnarled walking stick.  Ellie calls out the window. ELLIE (cont'd) Hey, there, Joe!

JOE waves.  They pass. ELLIE (cont'd) That's Joe Willy.  Took his family  hostage in November.  That was the most exciting thing that happened last year. I wasn't there, though. (grinds gear) Chief barely lets me handle anything above a misdemeanor.
Will looks over at her.  Smiles.
Don't give misdemeanors a bad rap.
But they're so boring.  All small stuff.
It's all about the small stuff.  Small lies.  Small mistakes.  Small oversights. People give themselves away in a traffic violation just as much as they do in a murder case.  It's human nature.
He looks over.  Ellie's listening intently. WILL (cont'd) Aren't you going to write that down?
Ellie, searching her pockets for something to write with.
Let me just...
Stops.  Looks over.  Realises Will's teasing her.
A small ranch house.  Aluminum siding.  FLOWERS piled up the front door.  TEDDY BEARS.  RIBBONS.  Left by well-wis
I haven't tidied up, since Fred told me not to touch anything.
MRS. CONNELL, a big woman with a thick grey braid down he back, opens the door to her daughter's room.  Looks at Wi
I don't believe in keeping a child's room like a shrine.
Will heads into the room.  Hap follows.  A palpable uneasiness between them.  Fred and Ellie stand in the doorway.  Mrs. Connell turns to go.

A small bedroom.  Pink shag carpeting and clouds painted the ceiling.  Pictures cut from magazines pasted on the walls.  A stack of tapes and a boom box in the corner. Will stands in the middle of the room.  Taking it in.
Typical seventeen year-old. (beat) She went to a party Friday night?
Down at a local dive the kids like to hang out in.
Fred throws Ellie a look.  "Kids?"  She's practically a k herself.  Will opens the top drawer of the bureau.  Roots beneath the panties.
No diary.
On top of the bureau, a stack of photos.  A couple torn u Kay Connell and a GIRL with white-blonde hair.  Laughing.
She left the party early.  Friends said she had a fight with her boyfriend and stormed out.
What time was that?
Around twelve-thirty.
Hap picks up a bear on Kay's bed.  A bell JINGLES when he shakes it.  Will crosses to a closet in the corner.
Who was the last one to see her alive?
Randy Stetz.  Her boyfriend.  We've questioned him, searched his place. Didn't find anything.
Will pulls a dress out of the closet.  Small, black, eleg The tag's been cut out.  He pulls out another, then anoth Feels the fabric.
These are designer.  Expensive. (looks up) Could Randy Stetz afford these?
Fred and Ellie exchange a look.
He fixes boat engines.
Will looks around.  Cheap wallpaper, torn window screens.
Well her mother didn't buy them for her.
What are we thinking?
Will reaches over to a heart-shaped box on the bedside ta Pulls out a pretty gold necklace.  Holds it up.
Kay Connell had an admirer.
He hands the dresses to Ellie.  Heads out of the room. WILL (cont'd) I want to talk to the boyfriend.
CLOSE ON a hand squeezing a shoulder.  Hard.
You don't seem all that sad.
The shoulder jerks away.  PULL BACK to reveal RANDY STETZ sitting at a wooden table in an interrogation room.  Long blond hair, wearing a Metallica t-shirt, trying like hell grow a moustache.
I haven't had a chance!  You fuckers been all over my back since Monday!
He takes out a cigarette.  It's bent.  He lights it.  Hap sits opposite.
You know smoking stunts your growth.
Randy throws him a look.
Yeah, okay, fat-ass.
(smiles at Will) More Alaskan hospitality.
Will goes over to a coffee machine.  Pours a cup.
Did you love her?
Huh?
Kay Connell.  Did you love her?
Randy flicks his ash.  Shrugs.
Sure.  She was nice.
Will turns with his coffee.
"She was nice."  Wow.  That makes me all soft inside.  Ever occur to you she didn't love you back?
Huh?
You heard me that time.
She loved me.  She wanted to see me every night.
But she was seeing someone else on the side.
Randy glares.
I don't know what you're fucking talking about.
Friday night, at the party - what'd you fight about?
Stuff.
What kind of stuff?
Just stuff.  I don't fucking remember.
The other guy?
I told you I don't remember.
After that she left the party to go to him.
How should I know?...
Ran like hell to go to him...
Fuck you, man! - I'm sick of all your fucking cop questions...
Will suddenly hurls his coffee cup and grabs Randy up by collar.  Nose to nose.

Now you listen to me, you little shit. This fuck-the-world-Metallica-t-shirt  crap may work with your mamma, but it doesn't work with me.  You got mad at your girlfriend because she was seeing someone else.  You want to be the last person who saw her alive or are you going to tell me who that is?
Randy's lip curls.  Red-faced.
I don't know.
You don't know.
She didn't tell me.
Disgusted, Will shoves Randy back into his seat.
Will walking out of the interrogation room.  Ellie joins
He's a little surly, isn't he?
Will smooths back his hair.  Checks his tie.
Just a little.
He reaches into his pocket and pulls out the gold necklac from Kay's room.  Hands it to her.
I want you to check this out, Ellie.
We already did.
Do it again.
But there wasn't any...
Will stops.  Ellie stops.  Will puts a hand on her should
The small things - remember?  The second you're about to dismiss something - look at it again.
Ellie smiles, teasing.
You want me to write that down?
Will, has to smile.  She's quick.  Looks down the hall. bearded GUY on crutches.  Ellie follows his gaze.
Who's that?
The bartender at Darrow's.  He was there Friday night.
Good.  He's up next.
Will heads over to him.  Ellie watches his neck.  Her han closing over the necklace.

The Pioneer Lodge restaurant.  Small, dark wood, a RADIO playing something between Bluegrass and Folk.  Some rough looking GUYS at the bar.  Throwing looks over at... Will and Hap, sitting at a table.  Studying faded menus.
(reading) Halibut Calabrese.  Halibut Olympia. Halibut Cajun Style.  Halibut fish and chips...
He puts down his menu.  Reaches for his drink. WILL (cont'd) Can't wait to see what's for dessert.
At least there's variety.
Will drains his drink.  Locks eyes with a big GUY over at bar.  Beer froth on his moustache.
Looks like the natives are restless.
Will?
Will looks back at his partner.  Hap's fidgeting with the of his tie. HAP (cont'd) I think, I think I'm gonna talk to Buck when we get back to Seattle.
A cold flash down Will's spine.
I wish I could stick it out like you.  I just, with Trish and the kids...
Don't do this, Hap...
Hap avoids his eyes.
I'm thinking I could get off with probation.  Keep half my pension.  That's all I want.
(hisses) Goddammit, Hap.  Think about what you're doing...
You don't have to be involved, Will.
You tell Buck and I'm involved whether I like it or not...
Ready to order?
The men look up, interrupted.  Rachel is standing by the table with a pad.  Hap tries to recover with a big smile.
Hey - you do everything around here?
Just about.
Will stands abruptly.  Eyes on Hap.  Trying not to explod
I'll just have another Scotch in my room. (turns to Rachel) If you don't mind.
Just then, his cell phone RINGS.
Will bursts into the bullpen.  Hap behind.
Where is it?
Ellie, Fred, and a couple other GUYS huddled around a des
Over here.

Will and Hap head over to them.  One of the younger guys, FARRELL, intimidated by Will's presence.  Tucks his shirt into his dirty jeans. They part to reveal a BLUE KNAPSACK laying on the desk. spots all over it.  An embroidered daisy.  Will examines
We're sure it's hers?
Has her books in it.
What about prints?
Ellie shakes her head, unfortunately not.  Will reaches i the bag.  Pulls out two text books.
Biology and Algebra.
He shoves the books towards one of the guys. WILL (cont'd) Find out who she studied with.
He continues through the bag.  Pulls out a little plastic with "Hello Kittys" all over it.  Dumps out the contents. WILL (cont'd) Make-up.
Looks up at Fred. WILL (cont'd) Find out where she bought it.
Fred looks at him.  Not happy with make-up duty.  Will pu out a hair brush.  Hands it to Ellie. WILL (cont'd) Lab.
Next, a couple worn paperbacks. WILL (cont'd) (reading titles) Otherwise Engaged, Murder at Sunset.
He looks up at the group. WILL (cont'd) Who here reads this kind of crap?
Farrell straightens.
I read that kind of crap.
Will tosses them to him.
Read them.  Tell me anything that strikes you.
Down to the bottom of the bag.  A Ziploc with a half-eate sandwich and an apple core.  Will hands them to Ellie. WILL (cont'd) Lab.
Upends the knapsack.  Scraps, paper clips, gum wrappers. WILL (cont'd) That's it.
Fred reaches for the knapsack.
I'll stick it in the evidence locker...
No.

Will, in a sweatshirt and coat, heads down the front step the Pioneer Lodge.  Jams his hands in his pockets.  The w of an insomniac.

Will walking down main street.  In the middle of the road The dead of night.  No cars.  The sky a blinding white. Hears some rowdy NOISE coming from a corner bar, beer lig flickering.  A WOMAN rides by on a bicycle.  Birds SINGIN Not day.  Not night.  Stuck somewhere in between.  Like a dream. Turns down a side street.  Passing more stores.  Guns and Ammo.  Patty's Hair and Nails.  General Store.  Comes upo

where he vomited the day before.  Stops.  Sees the DEAD D still down at the end.  Half obscured by the dumpster. Will wavers, pale.  Suddenly... A HOMELESS MAN emerges from the shadows.  Big.  Wild-eyed Awakened from his sleep.  Will, quickly backtracks to the sidewalk.  Spooked. JUST THEN the CRACK! of bat hitting ball.  He turns.  In distance.  Nightmute Elementary School.

A Little League game in full swing.  The uniforms, a litt faded.  The diamond, a little unkempt.  A smattering of SPECTATORS.  Mostly dads with six-packs. Will wanders over to the fence.  Spots Ellie sitting alon the bottom bleacher.
WATCHING HIM.  From afar.  The SOUNDS of the game, delaye few seconds.  Watches as Will crosses to the bleachers...
...and sits down next to Ellie.  She turns, surprised. ELLIE (cont'd) Detective Dormer!  What are you doing here? (looks at watch) It's two-thirty in the morning. Shouldn't you be asleep?
Will glances out at the game.
I could say the same thing about you.
Oh.  We always have play-offs in the middle of the night.  It's the best time.
Who's playing?
The Puffins and the Hawks.  We're in extra innings.  The Hawks have a really good line-up this year.
She sips on a take-out coke.  Looks back at the game.  A plump, redheaded GIRL comes up to bat.  Blows a bubble.
That's my sister.
Will looks over just in time to see the girl swing and mi by a mile.  Ellie cups her hands around her mouth. ELLIE (cont'd) (calling out) That's okay, Lib! (to Will) Usually she's better.
She your only sibling?
(nods) Twelve years younger.
Libby takes another swing.  Connects with the ball.  Drop the bat and runs to first.  Ellie gives a sharp WHISTLE. ELLIE (cont'd) What about you?  You have any siblings?
No. (rubs his eyes) Well.  I had a brother.  He died when I was eleven.
Ellie, sits up...
Oh, I shouldn't have...
It's okay.  Happened a long time ago.  He was killed in a fire.  In New Mexico.
That must have been awful for you.
Will leans back.  Stretching his legs.  Remembering.

Not really.  (slight smile) I remember I was more embarrassed that he had died.  Embarrassed that it made me different.  So I didn't tell the other kids at school what had happened.  They'd ask  me where he was, where he'd gone.  And I'd make up stories.  He was visiting an aunt up north, he'd broken his leg, he was in a  Swiss boarding school.  Stuff like that. (shakes his head) Nice kid, huh?  Just kept making up more and more lies...
Suddenly, he stops talking.  Slowly sits up.  Sensing  something.  Ellie, noticing the shift.
You okay?
The row of DADS behind them.  Jump up and start CHEERING.
WATCHING WILL.  Sees him sit up.  Look around.  That same prickle at the back of his neck.  A KID slides home just
...Will stands.  Trying to shake the feeling.
I'm going back to the Lodge, Ellie. Still need to go through some of Kay Connell's school records.
(unsure) Okay.
He turns to go, scanning the area.  Ellie calls after him ELLIE (cont'd) Try to get some sleep!
The Nightmute morgue.  Next morning.  A SQUAD CAR pulls u Francis gets out, whistling.  Starts for the morgue's entrance.
Will in the Cherokee.  Dark circles under his eyes.  Suit jacket wrinkled.  Pulls in next to Francis' squad car.
(calls out window) Officer!...
Francis turns.
I'll pick it up.  You head back to the station.
Will walking down a hallway.  Fluorescent lights. Cinderblock walls.  On his cell phone.
(into phone) Duggar - I'm at the coroner's now.  I'll be back in about twenty minutes...

Stops at an open doorway in time to see THE CORONER pull a sheet over the cold, blue body of Hap Eckhart. Will's heart lurches.  He grabs on to the door jamb.  Was ready for that.  The coroner looks up.
Detective.  Thought you were sending one of your lackeys.
Will clears his throat.  Closes his cell phone.
I thought it was better if I came.  Under the circumstances.
The coroner nods.  Goes to wash her hands.
It's different when you know them, isn't it? (nods to clipboard) Just sign over there and she's all yours.

Shrugs off her lab coat.  She's wearing a blue dress.  Lo like a piano teacher.  Heads into an adjoining office. Will.  Alone.  Steps into the room.  The smell of formaldehyde.  Bloody instruments on a stainless steel tr Walks towards the clipboard, eyes flicking over to the sh under the sheet when... SUDDENLY Hap's HAND drops down.  Thick fingers.  Wedding band. Will jumps...
Your partner didn't suffer much...
The coroner re-emerges from the office with a manila envelope.  Hap Eckhart written on it in black pen. CORONER (cont'd) Maybe for a minute or two.
Will rubs his face.  Tries to focus on the clipboard.  Th coroner holds out the envelope.  Smiles. CORONER (cont'd) Just enough time to reflect.
Thanks, Doc.
He takes the envelope.  The coroner peers up at him.
You're looking a little green, Detective.
Fred Duggar, dialing the phone at his cluttered desk.
So where's the other bullets?
He looks up.  Will standing before him, holding the manil envelope.

CLOSE on a key slipping into a padlock.  Opens with a CLI PULL BACK to reveal Fred and Will in a small storage room Standing in front of an army-green LOCKER.  The evidence locker.  Room's stuffed with old files and boxes.  MOOSE ANTLERS hanging over a small window.  Will glances up.
What's with all the moose antlers around here?
Fred throws a look over his shoulder.  Opens the locker.
Lots of moose.

INSIDE THE LOCKER - another manila envelope.  The name on this one: Farrell Brooks. Fred reaches back for the other envelope.  Will, hesitant give it to him.  Feeling the bump of the bullet in the bo corner.  Hands it over.  Wipes his brow.
When's Rich coming?
Fred slides it in beside Farrell's.  Closes the locker do
I'll call him now.
First I need a copy of the key.
Fred turns, a twinkle in his eye.
This isn't Seattle, Detective.  We don't have copies. (holds up key) This is the only one.
Will looks at him.  At the key.  Plucks it from his hand. Just then Nyback's SECRETARY appears in the doorway.
Detective Dormer?  Telephone.
The secretary hands Will the phone.  Pulls something from under the desk.  A beat-up BOX.  Will's name on it.
This came for you earlier.
Will glances at it.  Takes the phone.  Rubs his eyes.
(into phone) Dormer.
Nothing.  Someone's there but they're not saying anything Will, too tired for this shit... WILL (cont'd) Goddammit, Warfield, if you're gonna check up on me every...
Then...the VOICE.  A MAN's voice.  Not John Warfield's. This voice is medium-ranged.  Higher.  Nose sounds stuffe
I bet you haven't been getting much sleep.
Will straightens.  Something weird.
(into phone) What?
A little TITTER on the other end.
You lower-48s.  You think the white nights are kind of neat.  Then you can't sleep for days.  I've seen it happen about a million times.  But you can't sleep for a different reason.
(into phone) Who is this?
A PAUSE.  Will loosens his tie.
(into phone) I said, who is this?
The voice.  Dropping to a WHISPER.
I saw what really happened, Will...
Will, furrows his brow.
I saw you kill your partner.  With your back-up weapon.  Out there on the beach. I saw you shoot him dead...

Will Dormer's face. As all the blood drains from it. As all SOUND fades around him. As his heart begins to POUND against his chest. He falters, reaching out for the desk.  To steady himself As if the floor's just dropped out beneath him.  Eyes, darting around the bullpen...
(sotto, into phone) Now you listen to me...
Don't worry.  I won't tell anyone.  Oh, and I saw you take my gun.  My uncle's old 357.  I dropped it in the rocks. But you can go ahead and keep that.
CHIEF NYBACK, exits his office.  Looks at Will and smiles MAN'S VOICE (cont'd) ...I mean... (beat) ...Now that we're partners.

CLICK.  The line goes dead. Will, throat constricted.  Listening to the DIAL TONE. Smiles back at Nyback.  Turns.  Slowly hangs up the phone White as a sheet.  Trying to act normal.  Trying to act c SOUND returning to the bullpen, like nothing's different. Looks over at
sitting on the edge of the secretary's desk.  He reaches it.  Carefully, rips the packing tape.  Bends back a flap Inside, some dark blue material.  An embroidered daisy. Kay Connell's knapsack.
Will, heading for the Cherokee.  Clutching the box.  Face pale, pace quick.  Everything's different now.
Detective Dormer!
He closes his eyes.  Now is not the time.  Reaches the Cherokee.  Yanks open the driver's side door.  Ellie catc up with him.  Out of breath.
You look like you're in a hurry.  I just wanted to ask you about these pictures.

She smiles, holds up some PHOTOGRAPHS.  They're of the BE The ones Kepp took.  Almost all fog. ELLIE (cont'd) I know they're not great quality, but this is where you said you were when you first saw Detective Eckhart, right?
Will.  Barely glancing at them.  Tosses the box into the
Right.
Gets in and closes the door.  Puts his hand over the box. Ellie comes up to the window.
But here's the thing.  I retraced your exact steps according to your statement. You couldn't have seen Detective Eckhart from there.  I mean, not in that fog.
Then change it.
How much closer would you say you were?
I don't remember.
Five feet?  Seven feet?
Will, about to seriously lose his shit.  Looks at Ellie. Eyes dark, distant.
Listen, Ellie.  I don't have time for this shit.  Five feet, seven feet, twenty feet.  Put down whatever you want in your report, alright?
He turns the ignition.  Pulls out with a SQUEAL.  Ellie steps back, watching him drive away.  More curious than stung.
The Cherokee.  Parked off-road.  A remote spot by the wat The driver's side door, left open.  The PING-PING-PING of interior BELL.

Will Dormer, walking along a breakfront.  Aimless.  One f in front of the other.  Staring out at nothing.  The endl sea.  Waves CRASHING.  Wind HOWLING.  Seagulls SCREECHING Everything.  Closing in on him... He stumbles over a rock.  Grabs his head in his hands. Stunned.  Guilty.  Ashamed.  Fucked. He saw it.  He saw it! A WAVE, explodes nearby.  Drenching him in sea spray. Will turns, raking his hand across his face.  Blinking. stinging.  Trying to focus.  Trying to think this through Hears a dog BARKING in the distance. Shakes his head.  Looks at his watch. Got to deal with the problem at hand.

Will, bursts into his room at the Lodge.  The shoulders o his coat still wet with sea spray.  Crosses to the area o the floor where Kay Connell's files are still spread out. Starts pressing the floorboards with the toe of his boot. Testing.  Testing.  Until...he finds the one that SQUEAKS Gets down on his knees.  Hesitates.  Then jams his finger around the loose board.  Starts pulling it up.  Face reddening.  Knuckles whitening.  Slips his hand into the Pulls out a muddy 357 RUGER. The killer's gun. Will, stares down at it.

Will, standing at the mouth of the ALLEY.  Just like the night before.  Steps inside.  Cautious.  Eyes darting. Peering into the shadows for the HOMELESS MAN... Not there.  Coast's clear.  Heads for the dumpster at the of the alley.  Shoves it aside.  Looks down at... The DEAD DOG.  Rancid.  Rotting.  Will gags.  Holds a handkerchief to his face.  Waving away the flies. Then.  Pulls the 357 Ruger from his pocket.  Shrugs his c off and wraps it around his hand and the gun.  Looks away Fires a muffled SHOT into the dog's side.  The body kicks Crouches down.  Feels along the dog's ribs for the bullet point of entry.  Finds it.  Pulls out a PENKNIFE and exte one of the blades.  Cuts into the gash, fingers probing d for the lodged bullet.  He finds it.  Pulls it out. Looks back at the dog.  Takes a deep breath.  Wipes his b A little smear of the dog's blood left on his forehead. Turns and pulls a bottle of RUBBING ALCOHOL from his pock Douses the bullet.  Cleaning it.  Glancing at his watch. Running out of time...
The rear of the Nightmute PD building.  Will, looking aro heads briskly for the back door...

...steps into the HALLWAY leading towards the bullpen.  H VOICES.  Nearby.  Ducks back.  Waiting for them to fade. Safe.  Heads down towards the STORAGE ROOM.  Glancing bri at the PICTURES hanging on the wall.  Of old time POLICE OFFICERS.  Striking brave poses...

The storage room.  Hot.  Stifling.  The moose antlers LOO over his shoulder.  Will pulls the evidence locker key fr his pocket.  Unlocks the padlock.  Swings the door open. Pulls the Hap Eckhart envelope out.  Throwing a look over shoulder.  Opens it.  Shakes out the bullet that was lodg in Hap's spine.  Then fishes a plastic bag from his pocke The bullet he shot into the dead dog.  Drops that into th envelope and reseals it.  Hands shaking. Something.  Catches the corner of his eye.  He turns. HIS REFLECTION in the locker mirror.  The blood smear sti on his forehead.
Dormer...
Will jumps.  Quickly wipes the smear off and turns.  Fred Duggar standing behind him.  RICH by his side.  Will clea his throat, shoves Hap's envelope into Fred's hand.  Then Farrell's.  Angry.
These should have gone out two hours ago.
SLAMS the locker door and brushes past him.  Fred and Ric exchange a glance.
CLOSE ON a YOUNG GIRL's face.  Dark hair held up in two barrettes, wind tousling the curls.  Reading from a piece paper.
...And that's how I think Kay would want us to remember her...

PULL BACK to reveal Kay Connell's funeral.  PEOPLE standi by the grave, most of them HIGH SCHOOLERS.  The sky's a brilliant blue.  Red fireweeds blanket the hillside. YOUNG GIRL (cont'd) ...Swimming, reading, hiking through the Kebaughs...

stand off to the side.  Dressed in black.  Fred looks lik he's never worn a tie before.  Ellie holds a potted plant gift for the bereaved. YOUNG GIRL (cont'd) ...playing her flute, meeting at Darrow's after school...
Will.  Eyes bloodshot.  Not really listening.  Not really paying attention.  A thousand miles away.  Tugs at his collar.  Feels tight.
...And always, always with a smile on her face.

The young girl looks up.  Folds the paper closed.  People SNIFFLE.  Mrs. Connell, reaches out to squeeze her arm. Some CHILDREN.  Start circulating with plastic buckets. Filled with white carnations.  Handing them out.
Want one?

Will, startled, looks down.  A LITTLE GIRL stands before Curly hair.  Glasses.  Holding up a bucket.  He shakes hi head.  Looks back up at THE MOURNERS lining up to place the carnations on Kay's casket. AN OLD MAN with a brass-tipped cane.  Two GIRLS, look lik sisters, holding each other up.  A MAN with a thick red beard.  A LITTLE BOY, about five, clutching a FLUTE tied a pink ribbon... Will, looks away.  Then.  At the end of the line.  Someth catches his eye.

in tight jeans and a down vest.  In front of him stands a GIRL with white-blonde hair. From the torn pictures in Kay Connell's room. Will, straightens at the sight of her. Sees Randy surreptitiously caress her ass.
The service is over.  People are heading back to their ca Fred yanks off his tie.  Looks at Ellie.
We should go say hello to Mrs. Connell.
He starts off.  Ellie, looks back at Will.
You go ahead.  I'll be there in a second.
Ellie nods.  Catches up to Fred.  Will turns his attentio back to RANDY AND THE GIRL.  Over at the far end of the  cemetery.  Standing next to Randy's motorcycle.

location: AT THE EDGE OF THE FOREST

text: Randy gets on his bike, strapping his helmet on.  The gir about to get on behind him.
Why don't I give her a ride?
They look over.  WILL walking towards them.  The wind whipping his jacket.  His tie.  Randy makes a face.
Thought I smelled something.
Good to see you, too, Randy.

Will arrives at the bike.  The girl, TANYA FRANCKE, looks him curiously.  Her long white-blonde hair, her skin almo translucent.  Something sexy about her.  Has the carnatio stuck in the buttonhole of her jean jacket.
Who're you?
Fred shakes Mrs. Connell's hand.  Ellie waits.  Looks ove and sees WILL standing with Tanya and Randy. Shifts the plant in her hands.

location: AT THE EDGE OF THE FOREST

text: Will shows the gold shield on his belt.
Fuckin' cop.
Randy kick starts the bike.  It dies.  He kicks it again. Calls out over his shoulder.
You coming or not?
Sunlight dappling through tall fir trees.  Will drives. Tanya sitting next to him.  Her black skirt riding up. Picking at the flaking polish on her nails.
I never met anyone from Seattle before.
You're not missing much.
What are you doing in this shit-hole town?
Will, shifts.  Looks over.
You were good friends with Kay Connell, weren't you?
Tanya hesitates.  Pulls a cigarette from her purse.
I was her best friend.
Best friend?
Since grade school.
That's a long time.
We were like sisters.  Knew everything about each other.
Must be tough for you.  What happened.
Tanya shrugs.  Lights the cigarette.  Takes a drag.
Everybody says I'm holding up great, considering.  Don't even care if I go to school.  They're all worried I haven't cried yet.
She stretches.  Her midriff showing.  Shifts her body tow Will. TANYA (cont'd) But there's no law against not crying, right?
What about Kay's other friends?
Tanya makes a face.  Reaches out and taps the hula-girl.
Do we have to talk about Kay?  I don't want to talk about her right now.  Let's just drive.  Go somewhere.
Will looks over at her.  She blows out a plume of smoke. Smiles.  Seductive.
You want me to take you somewhere?
Long as it's fun.
She reaches out a sinewy arm.  Starts massaging the back Will's neck. TANYA (cont'd) Young, impressionable girl left alone with older, Seattle detective.  Who knows what we could get up to.
Will, impervious to the touch.  Head, throbbing.  Reaches the gear.  His foot, pressing harder on the gas.
SCREECH!  The Cherokee whips around a curve.
Tanya giggles.  Likes the speed.  Will, goes even faster.

The Cherokee breaks free from the forest.  Racing along a coastal road.  Water CRASHING against the rocks. Up ahead, a LOGGING TRUCK coming the other way.  The Cher shifts lanes.  Heading straight for the truck.
Tanya looks out at the truck.  Still giggling.
How about this.  You like this?
The truck BEEPS.  Will goes faster.  Tanya takes her hand from Will's neck.  Holds on to her seat.
The gap's closing fast.  The truck BEEPS again.
Tanya looks over at Will.  Not giggling any more.
Hey...
Thought you wanted something fun...
Will goes even faster...
The truck and the Cherokee.  On a collision course.  The truck BEEPS wildly.
Tanya squirming in her seat.  Not liking this any more.
Move over!

Will staring dead ahead.  Tensing his jaw.  The TRUCK... bearing down on them... Tanya reaches for the wheel...Will pushes her hands away. The TRUCK...a breath away... TANYA (cont'd) (screaming) Move over, you crazy fuck!
The truck and the Cherokee...just feet from each other... the last moment...the Cherokee jerks out of the way...
...SCREECHES to a stop near an old sign, Icicle Cannery. Gravel flying.  Will gets out.  Slams his door.  Rounds t car and opens Tanya's door.  She's screaming at him.
You crazy son-of-a-bitch!  You could have killed us!
Will reaches in and pulls her out of the car. TANYA (cont'd) Ow!  You're hurting me!
Will pulls her up a steep hill of garbage and broken crat Pushes her down the other side.  She stumbles. TANYA (cont'd) You want to tell me what the fuck this is all about?
Will stands above her, on the hill.  His face set like st
You and Kay were like sisters?
That's what I said.
Told each other everything. (heads down the hill) That why your picture's torn up in the top drawer of her bureau?
Tanya steps back. WILL (cont'd) Why her boyfriend's hand was clamped on  your ass at her funeral?

He grabs her by the arm.  Jerks it up.  She CRIES out.  W leans in. WILL (cont'd) You like games, little girl?  Well how about this one - you're standing right where her naked body was found wrapped up in a garbage bag.
Tanya's eyes grow wide.  She looks around her.  Disgustin rotten.  A SEAGULL pecking at the body of a dead bird.  S tries to break away...
No...
Who was Kay seeing besides Randy Stetz?
Tanya looks away. WILL (cont'd) Who gave her those dresses?
She struggles more.  No good.  Will's grip is like a vice WILL (cont'd) I need a name.
I don't know.
You don't know.
She wouldn't tell me!
But you were such good friends...
Tanya, squirming.  Angry.
It was like some big fucking secret!
What was?
She kept saying she was gonna get out of here.  Leave us all behind.  That he was going to take her!
Who?
My arm!
Who?
She used some stupid code name.
What was it?
Brody...I don't know... (crying) ...Something Brody!

Will straightens.  He's heard that name before. Suddenly Tanya jams her heel into his shoe.  He CRIES out She breaks away from him.  Runs up the hill.  Turns.  Tea streaking her face.  Throws the carnation to the ground. TANYA (cont'd) You happy now, you fucking bastard?

CLOSE ON a FINGER.  Running along a row of book spines. Brundt...Buckley...Buss...Buckham...Byrie... PULL BACK to reveal will in Nightmute's small bookstore. Still in his funeral clothes. In the "Mystery!" section.  Not finding what he wants.  T something catches his eye:  A BARGAIN BIN at the end of t aisle.  Will limps down to it.  Avoides eye-contact with YOUNG WOMAN shelving "New Arrivals!" Reaches into the bin.  Rummages through some paperbacks. Then he finds it:  Otherwise Engaged by Walter Byrd. Underneath the title, he finds what he's looking for: Another J. Brody Mystery.  Flips to the inside of the cov A BLURRY PICTURE of Walter Byrd.  Head turned to the side Walter Byrd was born in Watson Lake, Canada.  He graduate Will's eyes skip down to the bottom: Mr. Byrd currently lives in Umkumiut, Alaska, with his tw labrador retrievers, Lucy and Desi. Will looks up.  Slaps the book closed.
Will drives, sipping take-out coffee.  Trying to fight th stinging in his eyes.  Passes a sign:  Umkumiut, 30 miles
Will stands in a phone booth at the gas station.  Flips through the phone book.  His finger tracing down the "B"s Finds it:  Walter Byrd, 451 S. Diamond Tooth, Apt. B.
Sky's become overcast.  Will stands across the street fro pale blue building.  On the ground floor, a tackle store. Above, looks like several apartment units. He starts across.
Will heads down a narrow hallway.  Tiled floor.  Passes d "A."  Stops at the next one, "B."  Knocks.  Hears nothing the muted tv from apartment "A."  Pulls out his gloves.

With a CLICK the door swings open.  Will, gloves on, pock his credit card.  Hears the CHING CHING of dog collars as TWO LABRADOR RETRIEVERS stand at attention, GROWLING.  Wi prepared.  Takes a bag of treats from his pocket.
Lucy.  Desi.

The dogs break.  Trot over to him.  Wolf down the treats. Will scans the place.  Small, cheap.  Matching sofa and e chair, corduroy upholstery.  The walls, lined with old 19 movie posters.  All second-rate detective movies:  "Anoth Shot in the Dark," "Lady Luck," "He wore a Black Hat." Will walks across the room.  Repulsed.  The pathetic hove a killer.  Looks into the

Single bed.  Books and magazines.  A half-eaten tuna sand on the bedside table.  "NYPD BLUE" calendar on the wall. It's quiet.  He walks over to a large DESK by the window. Scattered papers.  Computer.  Mini cassette recorder. On the wall, hundreds of newspaper articles.  Some yellow some fresh.  All about cops: "Officer Louis Saved My Life "Shoot-out in Soho," "South Street Cop Takes Down Drug Ring," "Seattle Cop Killed by Suspect..." Will curls his lip.  Starts looking through the papers on desk.  Underneath a stack, he finds an 8x10 PHOTOGRAPH. of Byrd, standing in front of a big, lakeside HOUSE.  A R TOWER in the background.  Walter Byrd's face is blurred, turned to the side.  The photo from the book bio. Will takes it.  Starts roughly opening drawers.  A box of animal crackers, a rubber band ball.  Then, shoved in the back of the top drawer, an APPOINTMENT BOOK.  Will flips through to today's date.  Blank.  Shoves the book into hi pocket.  Slams the door closed. Then reaches back for his Smith 39/13.  Checks the magazi Slaps it back in place.  He's ready. SUDDENLY the phone RINGS.  A beige rotary on the desk. Plugged into an ancient answering machine.  It RINGS agai The answering machine WHIRS.  Then BEEPS.
Now you're mad at me.
Will freezes. WALTER'S VOICE (cont'd) ...I spotted your car around the corner. You must have been in a hurry.  Put some pieces together.  Don't worry, I would have done the same thing...

Will turns back to the window.  Looking furiously... WALTER'S VOICE (cont'd) Anyway... (blows nose) ...I'm not coming home.  So you shouldn't wait there all day.  I mean, they'll wonder about you at the station. You should be careful about following procedure, Will, especially now that...
Will lunges for the phone.  Snatches it up just as CLICK! tape cuts off.
Goddammit!
Enraged, he PUNCHES the receiver through the wall.

Will exits the apartment.  Cradling his hand.  Looks down the tile floor.  Scanning it for a broken tile.  Finds on Bends down and plucks out a broken corner. Places it carefully where the bottom of the door meets th door jamb.  Just then.  His BEEPER goes off.
Will strides into the bullpen.  Wounded hand in pocket. Ellie hunts and pecks at a typewriter.  Glances up. Fred, over in the corner.  SLAMS a drawer in the filing cabinet.  Turns.
Forget your pager?
What?
I beeped you over two hours ago.
Holds out a one-page report. FRED (cont'd) Got a fax from the lab.  Murder weapon was a 357 Ruger.
Will takes the report.  Heads over to the coffee machine.
Good.
And something else that might interest  you.
He reaches into his desk drawer and pulls out a book.  Ho it up.  Otherwise Engaged.  In hardback. FRED (cont'd) Remember this?
Will blinks.
No.
One of the paperbacks we found in Kay Connell's knapsack.
Will pours himself a cup of coffee.  Trying to keep the stream steady.  Ellie continues typing...CLACK...CLACK...
That's right.
Mrs. Connell found this copy in the  house. (opens it up) It's signed.  Personally.
So?
This is a local writer.  Kay had all his books.  I think we should check it out.
CLACK...CLACK...CLACK...Will rubs his chin.  Looks back a the report.  Judicious.
I don't think it'll lead anywhere.
The CLACKING stops.  SILENCE.  Will turns around.  Ellie' staring right at him - that isn't like him. He turns back to Fred.  Beat. WILL (cont'd) Well.  If he's local.  Give him a call.
The CLACKING resumes.

A dark stairway.  Late at night.  Will, bathed in shadows Climbs to the top.  Quietly, carefully.  He heads down a hallway.  We recognise it.  Back where Walter Byrd lives. Will approaches apartment "B."  Slowly pulls out his weap Cocks it.  Waits a beat then swings out in front of the d Ready to fight.  Ready to confront.  Looks down... Tile corner's still there.

CLOSE ON Walter Byrd's APPOINTMENT BOOK laying open. Scrawled in pencil:  8:30.  Dr. Agee. PULL BACK to reveal Will sitting in the parked Cherokee. appointment book on the passenger seat.  Been there all n Insomnia.  Taking its toll.  His hair, no longer neatly combed.  His face, pale and unshaven.  His eyes, dragged from fatigue.  Looks like the whole world's pulling him d Staring down the street at a BRICK BUILDING on the corner.  A placard by the front doo Dr. Florence Agee, D.D.S. Will checks his watch.  Rubs his eyes with the heels of h hands.  Suddenly.  Something tells him to look up.
in the distance, walking along the road.  Towards Dr. Age He's in his forties.  Short, shoulders sloped.  Wears a  beige, zip-up windbreaker, khakis, brown desert boots.
has a bulky hearing aid in one ear.  Is looking down at t road.  Glances up.
Byrd, slows his pace. Will, reaches for the door handle.

his short legs pumping, spots a TOUR BUS across the road. Veers over to it.
a runner's stride.  Weaves through PEOPLE.  Closing in on Byrd.  Sees his plan.  Cuts across the road just as...

rounds the corner.  THUMP!  Broadsides him.  Will's pitch up and over the hood.  Falls hard on the tarmac.  Dazed f second.  Blood, gushing from his forehead.  Hears the PIC DOOR open...FEET running over to him.
Are you alright?  You popped out from nowhere!
