He okay?
Will opens his eyes.  Trying to focus.  Looks up and sees the distance...WALTER BYRD getting on the tour bus. Will struggles to his feet.  The OLD LADY who hit him, wearing overalls.  Reaches out.
I don't think you should move.
Will stands, wavering.  Flashes her his badge.
The old lady rips along in the truck.  Will sits in the passenger seat, a handkerchief to his forehead.  It's soa with blood.  The lady looks over.
You sure you're okay?
I'm fine.
Careful not to bleed on my interior.
Will looks over at her.  Shifts in his seat.  Ouch.  Feel like a couple cracked ribs.  Peers out the windshield at TOUR BUS a few cars ahead of them.
AERIAL VIEW of the pick-up tailing the tour bus.  A windy coastal road.  Beyond it, a blanket of endless evergreens

A FERRY at the end of the pier.  A small wooden booth for selling tickets.  Beautiful, sweeping snow-capped mountai on the other side of the bay.  Nothing else for miles aro The pick-up pulls up next to the bus and a couple other c Will jumps out.  Scans the area for Byrd.  Nothing.  Then sees the last few PEOPLE boarding the ferry.

Ferry's getting pitched around in the roiling water.  Mos everyone is inside.  TOURISTS with throw-away cameras, backpacks, anoraks, CHILDREN.  Some looking sea-sick in t corner. Will weaves through the crowd.  Eyes darting, searching. ferry lurches to one side, the crowd sways, Will spots WALTER BYRD standing by a window.
Walter holds on to the railing.  Looking at the view, the spray.  Will comes up.  Stands next to him.  Cognizant of people around them.
Walter Byrd.
Walter continues looking out the window.  That same stuff nose voice.

When I was seven my mother and grandmother took me to Vancouver.  We were walking along the street one day when these two men ran past and snatched my grandmother's purse right from under her arm.  Right from under her arm.  That night a police officer came to our hotel  room to ask us questions.  Stood the whole time.

The ferry pitches again.  Will grabs on to the railing. Looking down at this little man.  Hate in his eyes. WALTER (cont'd) His uniform looked brand new.  His shoes and badge were polished, his billy club, his belt buckle.  All perfect.  He was like a soldier, but better.

Walter reaches up to blow his nose.  Will's eyes look on disgust - his knuckles are still red and swollen.  From beating Kay Connell to death. WALTER (cont'd)  Made a huge impression on me.  His goodness.  Gave me an instant respect for the police.  I tried to become a cop when I left high school, but...
He points to his hearing-aid. WALTER (cont'd) Congenital problem.
The ferry's engine HUMS to a stop.  Walter smiles. WALTER (cont'd) Oh.  We're here.

Gendreau Glacier.  Spilling down between two huge mountai Enormous in its whiteness, its coldness, its silent power Will and Walter walk up its face, away from the other tourists.  Walter leads the way.  Hands in his pockets.
You know this glacier moves a quarter of an inch every day?
He points off to the horizon. WALTER (cont'd) And on a clear day you can see all the way over to Newtok.  There's a beautiful aviary over there.  We can go sometime.
Will's lip curls.  Watching him. WALTER (cont'd) It's actually cool for this time of year. Normally the temperature runs about...
SUDDENLY Will lunges at him.  Walter's eyes widen in surp as he grabs him up by the collar.  Nose to nose.  Will ba keeping control.

You think this is a nice meeting we're  having here?  Friendly?  Two people getting acquainted? (jerks him harder) You sick, coward, fuck.  I get up every morning of my life just to bring someone like you down.  Beating a seventeen year- old girl to death.  Washing her afterwards, cleaning her.  Make you feel like a real man? (tightens his grip) Huh?
Walter flounders. WILL (cont'd) I outta end this right now.  Take a rock and smash your fucking skull in...
His jaws tense, nostrils flare.  Walter, red-faced, sputtering...
I stood right behind you...I saw you look right into his eyes and shoot him...
Will clenches his teeth. WALTER (cont'd) ...Seattle's great hero.  Shooting his own partner.  I saw it all...
That was an accident!  You hear me?  I didn't know it was him! (shakes him hard) I didn't know it was him!

Just then a SHRIEK.  Will looks over A COUPLE KIDS.  Further down the glacier.  Having a snowb fight. Will looks back at Walter.  Has to take it easy.  Shoves away in disgust.  Walter falls down onto the snow.  Dislo his hearing aid. Watches Will pace.  Head throbbing.  Ribs, screaming in p
Then why lie about it?

Walter brushes the snow off the dislodged hearing aid.  P it back around his ear. WALTER (cont'd) I mean, I'm all for bending the truth. That's what I do in my novels.  It's my  trade you might say.  But why cover it up?

Gets up.  Brushes the snow from his butt.  Checks somethi in his pocket. WALTER (cont'd) You don't have to tell me if you don't want to.  I'm sure you have some reason. Something noble.  I have faith in that.
Looks down at the kids.  Shakes his head. WALTER (cont'd) They should be bundled up better.
What's your game, Byrd?
Walter turns back to him.
No game.
The phone call.  The knapsack.
Walter shrugs.
I figured we're partners on this one.  I mean, after what I saw...
Will stops short.  Eyes burning.  It's all he can do not throttle this weed.
Let's get one thing straight, Byrd.  We are partners on nothing.
Walter looks at him.  Scratches his head.

I research my novels.  I know the  procedures.  You'd have cuffed me back at the ferry.  You'd have called for back- up, read me my rights, and gotten a search warrant for my apartment.  You're a well-respected detective.  There's no reason for you to be talking to me right now...
He takes out a handkerchief.  Blows his nose. WALTER (cont'd) ...except that we could help each other.
Will stares at him. WALTER (cont'd) So.  We're at an impasse.

Will runs his hands through his hair.  Half-crazed.  Hear pounding.  Turns to watch... THE KIDS down the glacier.  Making angels in the snow.  T GIGGLES carried along by the wind. Will, squeezes his eyes shut.  Trapped.  About to defy ev instinct in his body.
(sotto) You're going to get a phone call.
Walter steps up, tapping his hearing aid.
I'm sorry?
I said you're going to get a phone call.
(perks up) Oh?
Kay Connell had a signed copy of one of your books.
Thought you might find that.
You're going to be brought in for questioning.
Walter smiles.  Pleased.
Down at the station?
(hisses) Yes down at the station.
Walter rubs his hands together.  Thinking.
Okay.  Okay.  Brought in for questioning. Good.  I can write this.
JUST THEN the ferry blows its HORN.  Low and loud.  Walte looks down at it. WALTER (cont'd) Ferry's leaving.
He starts down.  Will watches him pass, has no choice but follow.  Walter, going over the details in his head. WALTER (cont'd) Something to divert...
Snaps his fingers.  An idea. WALTER (cont'd) My gun.  You still have my gun, right?
Will nods.  Walter smiles.  Spreads out his hands. WALTER (cont'd) Then that's the wild card.  Every detective story has a wild card.
What do you mean, "wild card?"
TOURISTS.  Boarding the ferry.
Next ferry's in forty-five minutes.
Walter heads over to the ramp.  Will stops, grabbing his side.  A PANG through his ribs.  Excruciating.  Calls out Walter.
What do you mean "wild card?"
Walter looks back.  Waves.
You'll know.  At the questioning.

Gives his ticket to the TICKET TAKER.  Gets on.  Walks ba to the stern.  Looks out at Will.  The HORN sounds again. Walter, at the rail.  Smiles.  The ferry's engine, churni up water.  Starting forward just as... Walter takes a MINI CASSETTE RECORDER from his pocket.  H it up for Will to see. Will, on shore, sees it.  A cold flash ripping through hi body.  That motherfucker.  Bolts through some tourists towards the ramp but... A couple of GUYS are just pulling it in.  The Ticket Take grabs his arm.
(to Will) Full up.
Will, jerks his arm away.  Stares off at the ferry.  Walt Byrd and his tape recorder.  Receding into the distance.

CLOSE ON a counter top.  Stuff thrown down.  Aspirin.  Ba aids.  Gauze.  Medical tape.  First aid cream.  Back pill Sleeping pills.  Bottle of scotch. PULL BACK to reveal Will standing at the counter in the convenience store.  His entire body aching.  The CASHIER, throws him a look.
I have a cold.
Will exits the store.  A bag under his arm.  We Miss You, looming over his shoulder.  Steps out onto the sidewalk a sees... ELLIE leaning against her truck.  Waiting for him.  Smile
Which way are you walking?
A tingle, all across Will's body.  Christ.  This girl's everywhere!  He hunches into his coat.  Flicks up his col Doesn't want her to see him fully.  Nods down the road.
Back to the Lodge.
Ellie grabs her bag.  Joins him.  They start walking.
I needed to get your signature on something.
She pulls a folder from her bag. ELLIE (cont'd) The report on Detective Eckhart.  Chief made me finish it this morning.  Said it was taking too long.
Will takes the file.  Flips it open.  The death of his partner.  Neatly typed.  Neatly stapled.  Pulls out a pen ELLIE (cont'd) Aren't you going to read it?
I trust you.
He signs.  Hands it back to her.  She slips it into her b ELLIE (cont'd) Now I can help you with the Connell case.  That writer's coming in tomorrow.  Walter Byrd.
A slight stutter in Will's step.
Duggar called him?
About an hour ago.  Said he was more than happy to cooperate.

Ellie looks over at Will as they cross the street.  Study his face.  His gait.  Noticing the slight limp in his rig leg.  The cut on his forehead. ELLIE (cont'd) You haven't been sleeping much, have you, Detective Dormer?
They arrive at the stone steps of the Pioneer Lodge.
Not really.

Isn't that the difference between a good cop and a bad cop?  A good cop can't sleep 'cause a piece of the puzzle's missing.  A bad cop can't sleep 'cause his conscience won't let him. (smiles) You said that once, remember?
Will, finally looks at her.
No.  But it sounds like something I would've said.
Turns and starts up the steps. WILL (cont'd) See you tomorrow, Ellie.
Ellie, watches him for a second.  Then calls out.
Oh!  I forgot to tell you.  The Puffins won.
Will stops, turns to look back at her.  Confused. ELLIE (cont'd) The baseball game.  Our team...
Slings the bag over her shoulder. ELLIE (cont'd) ...We won.

Clock flicks to 3:00 A.M.  Will, pacing in his room.  Shi off.  Rib cage wrapped in a bandage.  Looking through... A STACK OF MESSAGES.  All from John Warfield.  He discard them one by one.  Can barely focus... SUDDENLY the phone RINGS.  He lunges for it.
(grabbing it) Listen to me, you son-of-a-bitch...
Interrupted by a CLICK...
...I saw you look right into his eyes and shoot him...
Walter Byrd's voice.  Recorded from that afternoon. RECORDED VOICE (cont'd) ...Seattle's great hero.  Shooting his own partner.  I saw it all...
Will, hears his own voice... RECORDED VOICE (cont'd) That was an accident!...
Goddammit, Byrd!
Then, another clumsy CLICK.  Walter Byrd gets on.
You'd have done the same thing, Will.  I know you would...
He hangs up. Will SLAMS down the receiver.  Then again.  And again.  Y the cord out of the wall and HURLS the phone across the r

...The DARK FIGURE.  Disappearing back into the fog.  Clo in around him like milky water... We whip out our SMITH 39/13...plunge in after him...takin chase...BREATHING hard...leaping from rock to rock...the blanket thick...tightening around us... Our feet.  Hit water.  Up to our ankles.  Icy cold.  We run...sloshing through...when...

A DARK FIGURE.  Appears ahead.  Big and hulking...CRASHIN towards us... We raise our weapon...quick as a flash...as the FIGURE emerges... And in a split second... WE LOCK EYES WITH FIGURE's - his eyes, brown and gentle.. CRACK!  We fire!  The FIGURE grips his gut, falls into th water. Heart POUNDING.  Adrenaline PUMPING.  We slosh towards th body.  Something...catching our eye...
lying in the rocks.  Off to the side.  We grab it.  Turn to the body... And stop cold. That's when it hits us.  That's when we realize...
Will bolts up.  White as a sheet.
I didn't know!
His body, drenched in sweat.  His breathing, quick and ragged.  Caught up in the twisted sheets of his bed.  Loo across the room and sees
sitting in the corner.  Eating an apple with a penknife.
You sure about that, buddy?

He smiles.  Sympathetic.  Looks over at the window just a The BLANKET.  Drops to the floor.   LIGHT floods the room. INT. WILL'S ROOM - 4:02 A.M. With a GRUNT Will puts his back into it.  Shoving the hea oak bureau towards the window.  Sweat beading his face. A...few...more...shoves.  And the bureau finally stands i front of the window.  WIll stands back to take a look.  O covers half of it.
Fuck!
Red-faced, Will leans into the wooden armoire.  Shimmying towards the window...
Ellie.  Sitting in her truck.  Parked behind the Pioneer Lodge.  Rubbbing her eyes.  Sleepy.  Looking up at
concerned.

With one last heave, Will gets the armoire to the window. Light still shining through the cracks. INT. WILL'S ROOM - 4:50 A.M. Will shoving magazines, blankets, sheets, pillows.  Anyth To fill the cracks.  To cover the light.  His eyes.  Like crazy man's... SUDDENLY a knock on the door.  Will turns.
Detective Dormer?
Rachel standing out in the hallway.  Will opens the door.
(startled by his appearance) Will...I...
What is it?
There's a guy down the hall.  Complaining about the noise. (beat) Says he can't sleep.
Will gives a half-smile.  Fucking irony.  Heads back into
...his room.  Rachel follows.  Looks around at the mess.
Are you alright?
Will grabs up a sweater.
I'm fine.
He heads back over to the window.  Rachel now notices all stuff piled up.  Softens her voice.
Did something happen?
Will.  Cramming the sweater into a crack.
No.
Rachel walks up behind him.  His cramming, more desperate More urgent.
Will...
He grabs a magazine.
The light.  It keeps coming in...
Rachel reaches out.  Catches his arm.
Will.
He stops.  Looks down at her hand. RACHEL (cont'd) What happened?

Will suddenly realises what he's doing.  Absurd.  Patheti Pitiful.  Slowly turns to face Rachel. Her eyes, looking up at him.  His shoulders droop. Exhausted.  Rachel reaches up.  Catches him in her arms. Strong arms.  Caring.  Will buries his face in her neck. Wants to be swallowed up. Rachel holds him.  Arms encircling.  Will breathes her in Sweet, soft, safe. Looks up.  His mouth suddenly finding hers.  A kiss, hung urgent.  His arms move to surround her.

Will and Rachel in bed.  Spooning.  Rachel behind will, h finger tracing his scar.  Rain DRUMS against the window. Will.  Watching the raindrops streaming down the glass. Casting strange shadows against the wall.

There was this guy named Weston Dobbs. Twenty-four.  Worked as a part-time stock boy in a copy store.  Every morning he'd sit at the only window in his apartment and watch an eight year-old boy get picked up by his carpool across the street.  And every afternoon he'd watch the boy get dropped off again.  He did this for about six months.  Until one day he got up the nerve to cross the street and grab the boy before his carpool came. Kept him in his apartment for three days. Tortured him.  Raped him.  Made him do things...

Will tenses his jaw.  Rachel, listens in horror. WILL (cont'd) When he was done, he got a rope and a kitchen stool and hanged the boy in the basement of the apartment building.  But he didn't do a good enough job.  The little boy's neck didn't break and he died from shock.  The landlord found him five days later.
Rachel reaches for Will's hand.  Squeezes it.
One of your cases?

Me and Hap.  A year and a half ago.  I knew the second I met Dobbs that he was guilty.  Smug, cold.  Dead eyes.  We had circumstantial evidence, but nothing to tie him to it.  Nothing concrete.  Went over every inch of that apartment.
He pauses.
What happened?
Will turns slowly over to face her.  Her hair, splayed ou the pillow.  Her cheeks, flushed.  Her eyes, listening.
We took some blood samples from the boy's body and planted them in his apartment. (beat) Arrested him the next day.
Rachel looks at him.  Goose pimples on her arms.  Realisi the weight of the confession.
Will.
There've been other cases.  Where we've changed results.  Pushed witnesses. Manipulated evidence. (rubs his face) But Dobbs.  I wanted Dobbs more than anything.
He sits up.  Abrupt.  Wincing from the pain in his ribs. Rests his arms on his knees.
What if someone finds out?
We're under investigation now.  Back in Seattle. (beat) Hap wanted to talk.  As soon as we got back.  Thought he could work out some kind of deal.
Rachel rubs his shoulder.
Well, that's not going to happen now.
Will closes his eyes.  The rain, PATTERING.  Rhythmic.
Do you think it was wrong?  What we did?
There's a PAUSE.  Rachel, studying Will's back.  The cuts The bruises.  Not sure how to answer.

There are two kinds of people in Alaska.  Those who were born here and those who've come here to escape something in their lives. (beat) I wasn't born here, Will.  I'm in no position to judge anyone.  I'm not about that any more.
Looks out the window. RACHEL (cont'd) It's all about what you're willing to live with.

The clock reads 6:00.  Will pulls on his trousers.  Goes strap on his Smith 39/13 holster.  Grimaces with pain.  L at his back in the full-length mirror.  BLACK BRUISES see out from under his bandage. Puts the 39/13 and holster in the top drawer of the burea Turns and looks down at Rachel.  Sleeping soundly.
You were acquainted with the deceased, Kay Connell?
Will in the interrogation room.  Standing by the window. Tensed jaw.
Yes I was.

sits at the table.  Hair combed, wet.  Shirt newly starch A Styrofoam cup of coffee in front of him.  Playing the p Fred sits opposite him.  Report file open.  Ellie, next t Fred.  Taking notes.  She's combed her hair, too.
In what manner?
Walter smiles modestly.  Looks over at Ellie.
She was, not quite a "fan."  More an avid reader of my detective novels.
When did you first meet her?
Fred shoots Ellie a look.  She closes her mouth.
A year ago.  At one of my signings.
Ellie hands Fred the hardback of Otherwise Engaged.  He h it up.  Opened to the signature.
Where you signed this?
That's right.
What happened at that signing?
She flattered me about my writing.  Asked if she could visit me.  To talk about my books.
Did she?
Yes.  Not that much at first.  But then she became more comfortable.  Started  visiting me every week...
Will, from over by the window.  Interrupts.
What was the nature of your relationship?
Walter looks over.  Wide-eyed.
What do you mean, Detective Dormer?
Will turns.  Accusatory.
She was an attractive girl.  Did you have sex with her?
Walter blinks.
She was only seventeen.
But she was an attractive girl.
I suppose.
Did you have sex with her?
Fred shoots Will a look.  Ellie, watching him.
No.
But you wanted to.
I was a mentor to her.
Will heads over to Walter's chair.  Fists clenched in his pockets.
You gave her gifts.
Yes.
Expensive dresses.  A heart necklace.
Yes.
Doesn't sound like a mentor to me.
I gave her things she didn't have. Couldn't have.
He turns to Fred and Ellie. WALTER (cont'd) Her family lives on Mr. Connell's disability.  It isn't much.
Fred stops Will with a look.  Had enough.
We understand, Mr. Byrd. (to Will) You want to sit down, Detective?
Tense BEAT.  Will stares at Walter.  Revulsion.  Heads ba over to the window.
She wasn't happy.  I was someone to talk to.
How do you mean?
That boyfriend.  Randy.
Fred, sits up.
Randy Stetz?
That's right.
What about him?
He.  Well, he...
Walter hesitates.  Takes a sip of coffee. WALTER (cont'd) I don't want to talk out of school.  Kay told me things in the strictest of confidence.  As a friend.
Mr. Byrd.  Anything you can tell us could help out with this case.
Walter furrows his brow.  Taps his hearing aid.
Well.  He hit her.
Ellie's eyes widen.  Fred glances at Will.  But Will's to busy watching this little man weave his web.
Are you sure about that?
She'd come to me, sometimes in the middle of the night.  Bruises all over her back, her upper arms.  I pled with her to let me call the police, but she wouldn't hear it.  Wanted to keep it a secret.
Randy Stetz beat Kay Connell?
(angry) Ellie.
Walter looks right at her.
He has a terrible rage.  Kay even said he carried a handgun around with him.
Fred stands.  This is big.  Calls out the door.
Margaret!  Get Judge Biggs on the phone! (to Will) I'll get another warrant for Stetz's place.
Walter takes a sip of his coffee.  Cup's empty.  Holds it to Ellie.  Smiles.
Could I have some more coffee, Detective Burr?

Ellie nods, takes the cup.  Heads over to the coffee mach Fred turns back to the door... AND AT THAT MOMENT Walter levels a look right at Will. Mouths the words Wild Card. A shiver down Will's spine.  Wild card.  The gun.  Randy.
over at the coffee machine.  Pouring coffee.  Glances up the window.  Catches the reflection of the two men. An intense look between them.
CLOSE ON a BOOT.  Jumping down onto a black rock. PULL BACK to reveal Ellie walking out on the beach.  Head down towards the water.  Thinking.

A dark, narrow boarding room.  A HAND reaches through an window.  Feels for the lock on the door.  CLICK. Will enters Randy Stetz's place.  Cigarette butts, electr guitar, Hustler centerfolds tacked on the walls. He looks around.  Every inch of him revolting against wha he's about to do.
The sound of waves.  A slight breeze.  Ellie walking alon the water. Looking down.  Brow furrowed.  Stops and puts her hands o her hips.

Will heads over to a hanging sheet on the other side of t room.  Pulls it aside.  A MOTORBIKE being repaired.  Part and tools all over the place. Pulls the 357 Ruger from his pocket with a handkerchief. Spots a COFFEE CAN on a shelf.  Filled with thick oil.
Something catches Ellie's eye.  GLINTING from between the rocks.  She bends down.  Pulls a pencil from her backpack Spears something and holds it up. A SHELL CASING.

Will, drops the 357 into the oil.  Turns and heads back across the room.  Hesitates.  At the door.  Turns back. Looking at the oil can.  Takes a step back towards it whe hears... The sound of a SQUAD CAR.  Pulling up outside. Too late.
Will stands just outside the doorway into Randy's room. UNIFORMED OFFICERS inside searching the place.  Tearing d pictures.  Turning out doors.  Ripping up carpet.  Randy' voice.  In protest.
You can't fucking do this!
Will hears some SCUFFLING.  The sheet being pulled down. CLATTER of tools.
Hey!  I'm working on that!
Parts pulled off the shelves.  The bike, shoved to the si Then.  A SILENCE.  Followed by...
Found something.
Will shuts his eyes.  Heavy FOOTSTEPS head over to the bi Someone's pulled the gun from the can.
What the fuck is that!
Fred's voice, calm.
That's it.  Let's bag it.
More FOOTSTEPS.  Randy, desperate.
That's not mine, man!  That's not mine!
Will opens his eyes.  Fred's voice.  Almost sympathetic.
Randy...
No way, man!

More SCUFFLING.  A chair knocked over.  Something SMASHES Will looks down at the floor as FRED AND A UNIFORMED COP struggle to drag Randy through t doorway.  Randy writhes, kicks, tugs.  Screams. RANDY (cont'd) That ain't mine!
Fred grabs Randy's shoulder.
C'mon, Randy.
Randy squirms.  Turns.  Looks right into Will's eyes.  Go is the bluster.  Gone is the attitude.  Randy Stetz, lost kid.  Tears streaming down his face.
I swear to God.  I didn't kill her.  I  swear to God...
Will stands outside the garage apartment.  Wind whipping coat.  Watches as a Nightmute PD SQUAD CAR pulls off with Randy Stetz in the back. Fred sees him, heads over.
You look like shit, cowboy.
Will shifts his eyes to him.
That's an understatement.
Fred half-smiles.  Watches the receding squad car.
Looks like we can wrap this one up.
Will barely nods.  Fred pulls his baseball cap on. FRED (cont'd) We're getting together for a couple of beers later on.  Might not be the Seattle thing to do.  But you're welcome to come.
Fred puts out his hand to shake.  Truce.  Will looks at h Takes it.
CLOSE ON a tray of dark beer.  Five glasses, foam sloshin
I can't believe it.  Randy Stetz.

PULL BACK to reveal Farrell, Rich, Francis, and Will sitt at a small, round table.  Fred's passing out the beers. bar.  MUSIC blaring.  3 a.m. Happy Hour! banner on the wa Place packed with rough-looking FISHERMEN. Rich takes a glass from Fred.
What do you mean, you can't believe it?
He was an asshole.
That doesn't mean anything.
Fred sits.  Takes a sip of his beer.  To Farrell.
Didn't you grow up with him?
Farrell shifts in his seat.
Our dads were on the same boat. (to Will) We used to wait for them together.
Will nods.  Jostled by the crowd.  Reaches for his beer.
He used to pick fights at the gas station.
And remember when he did all those donut holes that one summer?
He and Francis GUFFAW.
Just a bad seed.
Farrell looks over at Will.
How do you like our beer?
Will slams down his empty glass.  Squeezes his eyes open shut.  Loud music.  Cigarette smoke.
I like it fine.

Francis grabs a handful of peanuts.
They don't have titanium shades over at the Pioneer.
Well no wonder.
You lose all sense of time.
Better than Fred's home town.
Will turns to Fred.  Wiping the foam from his moustache.
My people are from Barrow.  Way up north.
In the winter there's no sunlight for five straight months.
Like being swallowed up in a black hole.
Hi, guys.
They look up.  Ellie standing by their table.  Jeans, dow vest.  Hair tousled.
Nancy Drew!  Pull up a seat!
You hear what happened, Ellie?
Yeah.
Pretty cool.
Rich found the gun.
I know.  I heard.

Something's on Nancy's mind.
Ellie reaches into her vest pocket.  Pulls out a Ziploc w the SHELL CASING inside.
I found this out on the beach.

It's legitimate.
Worth pursuing?
He looks up.  Holds her gaze.  Then turns away.  Grabs th side of the table.

The guys don't protest.  Will starts heading for the bar. Weaving through broad shoulders, massive backs.  Smoke. MUSIC.  Laughter.  Arguing.  A mass of bodies and sound. Like being swallowed up in a black hole... Looks back at the table. Ellie, watching him.

SLAM!  Ellie heads through the front door like a gust of wind.  Thunders up the stairs.  Calls out.
Me, Pop!
We hear the TV in the other room.  An older MAN, Ellie's father, appears in the doorway.  Thick glasses, grey stub big paunch.  Wearing a flannel robe.
Ellie?  You okay?

Pitch black, then, CLICK! as a bare lightbulb's switched Ellie stands beneath it.  Piles of crap everywhere. She steps through the quagmire of old bikes, fans, auto parts.  Over to a stack of cardboard BOXES in the corner. She nudges through them, reading the writing on the tops. thick black pen.  Shoves a couple aside. Then.  Finds what she's looking for.  Pulls down a box marked:  Ellie Acad.  Tears it open. INSIDE - piles of papers, polaroids of her and her FRIEND schedules, syllabi, handbooks.  Stuff from her Academy ye At the bottom, a report.  The title:  "Securing the Crime Scene," the Leland Street Murders.  By Eleanor P. Burr. Ellie pulls it out.  Sits down on an old stool.  Opens to middle of the report.  Her finger, tracing down the  typewritten page.  Flips to the next page.  Then the next The next.  Then.  She spots it. THREE-QUARTERS DOWN THE PAGE, her finger finds the sentence:...Detective Dormer's unregistered Smith and Wes model 39/13 9mm, to immobilize Langley... Ellie looks up.  Chews her bottom lip.
CLOSE ON a huge wave CRASHING against a retaining wall. Spray flying. PULL BACK to reveal a small monument by the sea.  A stone cupola with a bronze statue underneath.  The sky, black w clouds.

Walter Byrd waits under the Mariner's Memorial.  Wind whipping his jacket, the green sea churning behind him. to a fifteen-foot statue of a SEAMAN, tall, rugged, tough Holding on to a thick coil of rope. Hunches against the wind.  Watches as... WILL approaches the monument.  Sonics sweatshirt, wrinkle coat.  Face drawn and haggard.  Angry.
(smiles) Hi, Will...
Will enters the monument.
What the hell are you doing calling me at  the station?
A gust of wind WHORLS through the monument.
I figured we should touch base.  Compare notes.  I think it went well.  What did you think?
Will's eyes pierce into him.
Randy Stetz is in jail.
Told you I could write an ending.
Congratulations.
Will holds out his hand. WILL (cont'd) The tape.
Walter looks at the open hand.  Hugs his jacket to him.
I thought maybe we could talk some more.
There's nothing more to talk about.
But we work so well together...
Will breaks.  Rushes Walter.  Slams him against one of th concrete pilasters.
We do nothing well together. (SLAMS him again) Nothing!  You understand me?
Another wave CRASHES.  Sprays them.  Walter looks up into Will's bloodshot eyes.
You run on two settings, Will.  I've  noticed that...
Will tightens his grip. WALTER (cont'd) You jump from calm to rage in the blink of an eye.  That's okay.  I do that too.

He holds up the tape.  Will grabs it, shoves Walter to th side.  Yanks the tape out of the cassette.  Steps back an HURLS it into the sea.  Waves engulf it hungrily. Walter watches him. WALTER (cont'd) You're not sleeping, are you?
What the hell do you know?
Kay told me.  She comes to me, you know.    Tells me things.  About you.  About me.
WALTER (cont'd) Does Detective Eckhart come to you?
Will curls his fists. WALTER (cont'd) Does he ask you why you shot him?
Whips around...

Then so was mine...
Don't you pull that shit with me.
I didn't want to kill her, Will.

Steps closer to him.  Beseeching. WALTER (cont'd) When she called me that night from the party, she'd had a fight with Randy. Wanted to talk.  I told her to meet me at our special place.  The cabin at the beach...

A couple RAVENS alight nearby.  Flapping their wings. SCREECHING into the wind. WALTER (cont'd) ...When she came she was barefoot.  And there was liquor on her breath.  I only wanted to comfort her.  To touch her. She could have at least let me do that. Her skin...it was like everything I'd ever written about.
A dark shadow crosses his face.  Holds on to the coiled r of the statue.  Will hisses.
Couldn't get it up, Walter?
It was when I went to kiss her.  She started laughing.  I got angry.  After all I'd given her.  All I'd shared with her.  I just wanted to make her stop. That's all.
Walter.  Squeezing the bronze rope. WALTER (cont'd) From calm to rage in the blink of an eye.
Locks eyes with Will.  Conspiratorial. WALTER (cont'd) Remember?
WILL'S HAND shoots out.  Clamps around Walter's neck.
Like this?
Walter's face, starts turning red.
Yes.  Like that.
This an accident, Walter?
If you want it to be...
Will looks deep into Walter's eyes.  Squeezing harder.  P hatred.
It took ten minutes to beat Kay Connell to death.  Ten minutes.

Their eyes, locked.  Veins, popping along Walter's temple Lip quivering... JUST THEN a BELL sounds in the distance.  Will looks up. A LINE OF FISHING BOATS coming back in. Will, looks back at Walter.  Throws him to the ground. Sickened. WILL (cont'd) Get the fuck out of town, Byrd.  Leave and never come back.
Walter COUGHS.  Holding his neck.  Enjoying this.
I have a summer house up by Kgun Lake. I'm going to write my next novel there. It's about a famous detective who goes bad.

He pulls himself to his feet.  A little unsteady.  Takes a handkerchief.  Dabs his forehead. WALTER (cont'd) The never coming back part, though.  I'm not sure.  To tell you the truth this has been kind of fun.  Going to the station, meeting all those nice people.  Talking with you.
He shrugs.  Walks past Will. WALTER (cont'd) I might miss it.
Will turns.  Watches him walk away.  Walter hesitates.  T back. WALTER (cont'd) I especially like that new detective.
Will looks at him.  Back straightening. WALTER (cont'd) Detective Burr. (smiles) I liked her very much.  Has a real vitality.
Will's stomach jumps.  Walter turns back.  Continues on. The little man in a beige windbreaker.
CLOSE ON a HAND.  Signing the bottom of a form.

PULL BACK to reveal Chief Nyback sitting at his desk.  Wi stands before him.  Signing papers.  A bottle of bourbon the desk.  Some paper cups half filled. CHIEF NYBACK (cont'd) When are you taking off?
Will checks his watch.
Six-thirty.
Fred, standing over by the filing cabinet.  Toothpick in mouth.
If Spencer's not too drunk to fly.
Nyback chuckles.
Can't talk you into staying for a couple of days?  Do some fishing?  Show you what normally goes on around here.

I have to get back.
Too bad...
Looks over at Fred picking his teeth. CHIEF NYBACK (cont'd) ...Brought some real class to the place. But, Seattle needs its hero back. (stands) Couldn't have done it without you, Will.
Will caps the pen.  Uncomfortable.  Nods towards Fred.
Had a lot of help from Nightmute's  finest.
JUST THEN the door swings open.  They look over as ELLIE hurries in.  She smiles.  Looks tired.
Didn't want to miss anything.
Detective Dormer's not leaving for a few hours.
Good.

An awkward beat.  Ellie walks over to Will.  Looks up. Suddenly throws her arms around him. ELLIE (cont'd) I thought what you did on this case was amazing.
Will holds his hands out.  Not sure what to do.  Looks do at the top of Ellie's head.
slips down his back.  Feeling for a holster.  For that 39 Nothing.  She breaks away. ELLIE (cont'd) We're really going to miss you around here.
She and Will lock eyes.  Hold for a beat. He knows exactly what she was trying to do.
Will, driving down Nightmute's main street.  He takes a l Goes up a hill.  Glances out the window.  Passing by THE CEMETERY.  A cluster of headstones.  Something catche his eye.  He stops the car.

on the other side.  Newly dug.  A mound of dirt.  Flowers scattered by the wind.  Daughter and Friend...1982-1999. Will.  Grips the bars.  As if he's seeing it for the firs time.  Really seeing it. Closes his eyes. What have I done?

Will's REFLECTION in the mirror.  He's showered.  Hair's combed.  Put on a clean suit.  Steps back.  Smooths down lapels.  Just right. Turns to face the room.  Bed's made, mess cleaned up.  He heads over to the bureau, pulls out his Smith 39/13.  Lay on the bed. Unclips his badge from his belt.  Lays it on the bed.  Ta something from the bedside table.  The BULLET found in Ha Eckhart.  Lays it on the bed. All neat.  All ordered. Reaches under the mattress.  Pulls out the PHOTOGRAPH of blurry Walter Byrd standing in front of a house.  A radio tower in the background.  The call numbers: WKOZ. Will studies it.  Tears it in half.
Rachel in the back room behind reception.  A pullman's kitchen, a desk, an old recliner.  Pouring some milk into bowl for a CAT.  A stray. Will walks in.  Rachel turns, smiles.

Will stops the car at the end of a narrow dirt driveway. Looming before him... A HOUSE right on the lake.  Tall, wooden, in disrepair. Chipping yellow paint.  A ghost of what it once was.  The house from the photograph.

Light patches on the walls whe pictures used to hang. BARKING outside.  Walter cocks his head.  Gets up.  Walks over to the window.   OUTSIDE.  Will walking up to the house.  Lucy and Desi jumping around him.

Will opens the screen door with a CREAK.  Steps into the living room. Recoils from the smell.  Flies BUZZING.  Yellow plastic covering the sofas.  Boxes, books, papers, pictures piled high everywhere.  Wallpaper faded, peeling. Everything, decaying.
Ellie ripping along the forest road in her truck.  Grippi the wheel.  The photograph pieces, taped together on the passenger seat.

Will heads down a hallway.  Dark, narrow, floorboards wor More shit stacked up. Each step, careful, quiet.  Tracking.  Listening.  A BREE sweeps through.  The burned-out lightbulb hanging from th ceiling, starts swinging.
Here to visit me?
Will whips around. WALTER standing there.  At the other end of the hallway. Shoulders slumped. Will shakes his head.
No.
FLIES, bouncing against the screen door. WILL (cont'd) I'm here to end this.

Where's your back-up?

Slowly reaches into his jacket... WILL (cont'd) There is no secret.  Because the biggest difference between you and me is what we will or will not live with...
Pulls out his SMITH AND WESSON.  Walter.  Looks at the gu Inches back.
Will...

The pain, blinding.  Will GASPS. CRACK! again, CRACK! again, CRACK! again.  Walter's face. Calm, flushed.  A vein along his temple.   Will's eyes flutter.  Blood, spewing from his lips.  A TH to his kidneys.  Walter stops, out of breath.  Hand on hi

WILL'S HAND suddenly shoots out.  Grabs the shotgun barre WALTER stumbles back.  The shotgun goes off.  BAM!  Chunk ceiling rain down.  Walter falls to the ground.

Will, covered in dry wall, struggling to his feet.  Reach for his Smith and Wesson. WALTER'S DESERT BOOT kicks it out of the way.  It SKITTER down the hall. Walter grabs his shotgun.  Scrambles to his feet.  Runs d to the end of the hall.  Ducks into...
...the library.  Dirty shelves, strings of dust.  Endless books.  He races over to a cabinet.  Yanks open a DRAWER.
Will, on his feet, trying to focus.  His suit, soaked wit blood.  Looking for his gun.  Spots it, in the corner...

Walter jerks open another drawer.  A STACK OF BOOKS teete the top of the cabinet.  He finds what he needs.  SHELLS. Grabs a handful... THE BOOKS tumble down on top of him.  He CRIES out, cover his head...touches his ear, panics - hearing aid's gone! Looks up.  Will, coming down the hall...
Will hobbles into the library.  Sweeps the room with this No Walter. Steps on something, crushing it.  Looks down.  Walter's hearing aid.  Kicks it aside.
Ellie.  In the front hall.  Following procedure.  Right h gripping the gun.  Left supporting the butt. Blinks away sweat.  Facing three doorways.

Ellie.  Gun swinging.  Doorway one.  Doorway two.  Doorwa three...SUDDENLY

runs past number one.  Big.  Shadowy.  The flash of a GUN She wheels toward it.  Finger on the trigger... SLO-MO...The FIGURE, passing.  Her heart, POUNDING.  Her finger...squeezing... Will Dormer or Walter Byrd? At the last second, she jerks the gun away.  The figure  disappears.  She swallows.  Gripping the gun.  Follows.

The sky, heavy with clouds.  The air, foreboding.  Will steals out the screen door.  Gun cocked.  Eyes scanning. Wind, bending the weeds, the trees. BAM! a shot.  Out of nowhere.  Rips into his thigh.  Will CRIES out.  BAM! a second shot.  Whizzes past him...
...CRACK! the shot bites into the window frame.  Wings El halfway across the room.  She drops to the floor.  Clutch her shoulder.  Flesh wound.
Shit!
Pulls herself over to a SIDEBOARD for cover.  Shrinks beh it.  Notices A PLASTIC BAG sticking out from one of the drawers.  Nudg it open.  A flowered dress, some panty-hose, strands of l dark hair...
Will.  On the ground.  Gripping his leg.  Looking wildly around.  No sign of Walter.  Then.  He sees it. Lucy and Desi.  Down by the boathouse.

The boathouse.  Old, rotted wood.  Crumbling beams. Walter stands at a window.  Re-loading his shotgun.  He fumbles, drops a shell.  It rolls towards a crack in the floor.  Falls into the LAKE WATER below. CLICK!  Walter levels the shotgun out the window. WALTER'S POV - the long, undulating WEEDS outside.

Will.  Pulling himself through the weeds.  Losing blood f Dragging his body.  Approaches the side of the BOATHOUSE. WALTER'S GUN BARREL, sticking out. Will ducks his head.  Winces in pain.  Breathing, becomin ragged.  Rounds to the other side.  Hoists himself up to another WINDOW.  Cautiously looks in... WALTER at the far window. Will jerks back.  Steps on the dock.  A plank CREAKS.  Sh Peers back through the window.   WALTER.  Still looking out.  Didn't hear a thing. Will remembers.  Walter doesn't have his hearing aid.  He deaf on that side.
Walter, looking out the window. OVER HIS SHOULDER - we see Will climbing in through the window.  Smearing blood along the sill, favoring his leg. Stands straight.  Levels his gun at Walter's back.
(softly) Walter?
Nothing.  Walter continues staring out the window.  Will raises his voice. WILL (cont'd) Walter!
Walter jumps, whips around.  Comes face to face with the  barrel of Will Dormer's gun.  Surprised.  Absently touche his deaf ear.
Wild card.
Drop the gun, Walter.

That jammed the last time, remember?

The men LOCK EYES.  Wind HOWLING through the boathouse. Killer and Detective.  Only a bullet separating them. WALTER suddenly jerks up his shotgun... BANG!  He stumbles back.  Hit in the gut. Will's Smith and Wesson, smoking.  No longer jammed. Walter, touches the blood.  Looks back at Will.  Staggeri CRACK!  The rotting floor gives way beneath him.  He CRIE out, falls.  Drops into the icy water below. SILENCE.  Will steps over to the hole.  Looks down at WALTER, floating on his back.  Looking up at him.  Water washing over his body.  Eyes, pleading.  Fading.  A wave, gently pulls him away.
Another J. Brody mystery.

Will staggers out on to the dock.  Drops his gun.  Crashe his knees.  Falls back.  His face, pale.  Lying against t wood of the dock. RAIN DROPS.  Start to fall.  Washing the blood from his s Puckering the lake water.  Will's eyes...flutter... FOOTSTEPS...running along the dock.  Heavy boots...
Detective Dormer!
Will squints against the rain.  Makes out the face of ELLIE hovering over him.  He gives a half-smile.
God, you're a pain in the ass.
Ellie kneels down next to him.  Pulls over her vest.  Cov him.
You're shot.

You, too.

I'm going to make a tourniquet.
Will, fading fast.
Walter Byrd killed Kay Connell.  Her things are in the house.
I know.
Byrd's dead.
Ellie, wraps the sock around his leg.  Starts twisting. grimaces.  Ellie swallows.  Doesn't want to ask this.
You shot Detective Eckhart, didn't you?
Will nods.
Yes.
A pained looks crosses Ellie's face.
Did you mean to?
Will shakes his head.
No.  But I covered it up.  I lied.
Why?
RAIN, drumming down around them.  Will, takes a deep brea
Because I just couldn't be wrong. (looks at her) Don't ever get that way, Ellie.  Don't  ever lose your way.  It blurs the line.
His blood, pumping out in rivulets.  Ellie looks down at Her hero.  Moves up to the wound in his arm.
This one looks worse.
Will reaches up a feeble hand.  Stops her.
(whispers) Just let me sleep, Ellie...
His eyelids, growing heavy. WILL (cont'd) Let me sleep.
Ellie blinks away the tears.  Knows what he means.  What wants.  Watches as the calm spreads over him. Will closes his eyes.
No!

Will opens his eyes.  She ties the second sock around his arm. ELLIE (cont'd) I will not let you sleep.  If you've lost your way then you have to make it right. That's the only way.  That's what you'd tell me.  I've been a detective for four weeks and I say you're coming with me.
She gets up.  Slips her arms under his shoulders.  Starts hoisting him up. ELLIE (cont'd) C'mon...
Will.  Struggling to his knees.  Every inch of him, screa in pain.  Gets to his feet.  Arm slung around this tiny, young woman.
What about your shoulder?
Don't worry.  I'll have a cool scar.
